title: Field Of The Eagle And Lion
opening: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion, a traditional contest of strength between the three houses, has arrived. It will take place at Gronder Field, which lies in Imperial territory.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Professor, you already know about the Battle of the Eagle and Lion, correct?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Only the name.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I can't recall.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: I see. In that case, allow me to fill you in. It's a large-scale mock battle between the rival houses that takes place every year.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: Its scale is incomparable to the mock battle we fought during the Great Tree Moon. It will take place in the vast Gronder Field. That is in Empire territory to the southeast of Garreg Mach.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Whichever house defeats the most opponents wins. Of course, the professors also fight alongside their respective houses.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: Well, usually. Professor Manuela is being prudent. She will not be participating this year. Since his long-time rival will be absent, Professor Hanneman has also declined.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In that case, I must sit out too.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What should I do?

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Oh, don't worry about us. You know you wanna see the kids in action.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: Are you feeling any better, Professor Manuela?

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Thanks to all of you. But I'd only be a burden out there. My students don't need to see me collapsed. Well, not on the battlefield, anyway.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: Correct, we will not be participating. Regardless, do not expect victory to come easily. Or at all.

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Well put. We've spent the past few months pushing our students to their limits. You can see me in the infirmary after they destroy you.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: If I'm the only professor present...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: This doesn't seem fair...

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Oh my, look at you. If you're as confident as all that, my students will walk all over you.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: We have taught our students well. There is no need to hold back. Challenge them with everything you have!

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion is finally upon us! This is our chance to show off the results of your expert training, Professor.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Have Lady Rhea and Seteth really not filled you in? Well, if that's the case, I'm happy to explain.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It slipped my mind.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Haha, I highly doubt that. If you don't mind, I'd be happy to explain.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion takes place every year during the Wyvern Moon. It can best be described as a mock battle between the three houses.

dialogue.speaker: Dedue
dialogue.line: Much like the one we had during the Great Tree Moon. Do you remember, Professor?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Yes, I remember.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I remember our celebration most of all.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: It was certainly an unforgettable time. I've never seen anyone put away as much victory food as you did that night, Professor!

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: This battle will take place in Empire territory, at Gronder Field. In other words, far removed from the monastery. It's a mock battle between the three houses. The house that defeats the most opponents wins.

dialogue.speaker: Dedue
dialogue.line: Your Highness, if the rumors are true, I believe Professor Manuela and Professor Hanneman will not be joining us.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Ah, yes, right you are. Given recent events, Professor Manuela has opted to sit this one out. Since she won't be present, Professor Hanneman has decided to skip this year as well.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In that case, I must sit out too.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What should I do?

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Oh, don't worry about us. You know you wanna see the kids in action.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Professor Manuela! Are you feeling better already?

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Thanks to all of you. But I'd only be a burden out there. My students don't need to see me collapsed. Well, not on the battlefield, anyway.

dialogue.speaker: Dedue
dialogue.line: In that case, perhaps it is best that you sit this one out.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: Correct, we will not be participating. Regardless, do not expect victory to come easily. Or at all.

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Well put. We've spent the past few months pushing our students to their limits. You can see me in the infirmary after they destroy you.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: If I'm the only professor present...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: This doesn't seem fair...

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Oh my, look at you. If you're as confident as all that, my students will walk all over you.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: We have taught our students well. There is no need to hold back. Challenge them with everything you have!

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: It's finally time! The Battle of the Eagle and Lion at Gronder Field is this month. Don't tell me you forgot, Teach?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It slipped my mind.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: You're kidding! Come on, Teach, I need you to keep it together for me. Don't lose focus when it counts.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I know little about it.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: You're kidding! Didn't Rhea or Seteth fill you in? Guess I have to do everything myself around here.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion is one of the academy's annual traditions. It's a huge mock battle between the three rival houses.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: But you know all about rivalry battles, Professor. There was one right after you got here, remember? I hear the Battle of the Eagle and Lion will be held in Gronder Field, far away from Garreg Mach.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The house that defeats most opponents wins. It's a three-way battle that relies heavily on strategy. Sounds exciting, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Hey Claude, what about Professor Manuela? Do you think she'll be able to join us despite her injuries?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I'm afraid she's sitting this one out, as is Professor Hanneman.  "As my persistent rival will not be present, it only goes to follow that I must also sit out this year's battle. Now leave me be, Claude!"

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In that case, I must sit out too.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What should I do?

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Oh, don't worry about us. You know you wanna see the kids in action.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: If it isn't our own Professor Manuela! All things considered, you're looking well.

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Thanks to all of you. But I'd only be a burden out there. My students don't need to see me collapsed. Well, not on the battlefield, anyway.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Does that mean you really won't be joining us for the battle?

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: Correct, we will not be participating. Regardless, do not expect victory to come easily. Or at all.

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Well put. We've spent the past few months pushing our students to their limits. You can see me in the infirmary after they destroy you.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: If I'm the only professor present...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: This doesn't seem fair...

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: Oh my, look at you. If you're as confident as all that, my students will walk all over you.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: We have taught our students well. There is no need to hold back. Challenge them with everything you have!

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: Hmph. This monastery is more dangerous than I expected. It's likely that our foes have infiltrated the ranks of the teachers... And there may be others of questionable character about as well! If you ask me, there is something amiss about that old man...Tomas.

conversation.speaker: Monica
conversation.line: What do you say, Edel? Shall we meet up in the library later to... Oh! Hello, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Do you need something? I'm a little busy at the moment.

conversation.speaker: Monica
conversation.line: Sorry, Professor! I've got a lot of questions to ask Edel here. Since I couldn't graduate last year, I really want to make sure I can do so this year. Don't worry. I won't participate in any assignments so as not to take any attention away from the younger students. I look forward to learning from you, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Monica
conversation.line: What do you say, Edel? Shall we meet up in the library later to... Oh! Hello, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Do you need something? I'm a little busy at the moment.

conversation.speaker: Monica
conversation.line: Sorry, Professor! I've got a lot of questions to ask Edel here. Since I couldn't graduate last year, I really want to make sure I can do so this year.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion... Its name comes from the war in which the Kingdom won its independence from the Empire. It's imperative that we fight our best. We must live up to the legacy of the King of Lions.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: To hold a fishing tournament at a time like this... Participate if you must, but I urge you not to lose sight of our goal. As for me, I won't be joining in. I'm so focused on the battle ahead, I fear I would snap my poor rod right in half.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Flayn and...Monica, was it? I'm glad they were returned safe and sound.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Going all the way to the Empire for a mock battle? This is serious business. And there's a reward to be had as well. I'd really like to win this thing. Everyone else seems to be raring to go too. We're all looking to you to guide us, Teach.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Going all the way to the Empire for a mock battle? This is serious business. And there's a reward to be had as well. I'd really like to win this thing.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Seteth, that stubborn goat. Holding a fishing tournament now? Just last month he looked like death warmed over.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion is a free-for-all contest among the three classes. If you are victorious, the archbishop will no doubt present you with a reward.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Consider me motivated.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not interest in rewards.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: Just what I thought you'd say.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: You know, the Empire used to control all of Fódlan. But after the civil war, the northern region split off and became the Kingdom. Later, the eastern part of the Kingdom seceded to become the Alliance. There are three powers today, but a thousand years ago, we were all united as one. Even now, among the nobles of the Empire, there are some who dream of reunifying Fódlan...

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I'm just absolutely exhausted. I swear to you, Professor, every month we're worked harder than the month before. I had imagined the academy as a chance to possibly relax before our lives began in earnest.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You came to the academy to relax?

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: After graduating, we'll enter into noble society, which mean contending with all the intrigues and dramas that entails. I want to just...postpone life for a bit. Fish... Nap under a tree... Skip out on lectures and– Well, not on your lectures of course, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It is what it is.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Agreed. That's the Church of Seiros for you. What is it they say? "Those with power are obliged to use it."

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Are you gonna participate in the fishing tournament, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Hi, Professor. Want to know something? Gronder is in the territory of House Bergliez, in the Empire. That's right next to my home, the region of House Varley! Oh. Oh no. What if– What if my parents come to watch?! Aaah!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Calm down.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: I'm calm! Of course I'm calm! Why wouldn't I be calm? Ugggh!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't think nobles are allowed to watch.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Really? Are you sure?! You wouldn't say that if you weren't completely sure, right?!

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Fishing? No thanks. I tried it once, and...ugh. Gross. I don't even really like to eat fish, let alone catch and gut them. Besides, who can think about fishing right now? The Battle of the Eagle and Lion is coming up soon. Feeling confident?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Very.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: That's the spirit!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Not really.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Oh, have a little faith in yourself, Professor. You'll do fine, I'm sure of it.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I fished with frequency back in Brigid. I will not have losing. Will you be trying to fish too?

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion draws near. His Highness insists upon training well into the night. He has said it is nothing to worry about. But how could I not be concerned?

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: Did you want something?

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: Ever since the tournament, the kitchen is completely overtaken with fish. The cooks cannot keep up.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: I'm not interested in glory or prizes. All I want is a formidable enemy to sink my teeth into. As far as I can see, there are only a couple of opponents worth my time.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Since we were little, Ingrid's always gotten this odd look in her eye when someone brings up food.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: You know, I'm pretty good at fishing. My older brother used to take me out. Why don't you give it a try too? They say we can eat whatever we catch!

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: A fishing tournament, huh? Sounds fun, but not as fun as reeling in the ladies. Heh! Just kidding, of course. The most important thing right now is preparing for the Battle of the Eagle and Lion. After all, the ladies love nothing more than a winner. And around here, there's no bigger game.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's the wrong reason to compete.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Everyone has their own reasons to fight. At least I'm honest about mine.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm sure they do.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I knew you'd understand, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Hmm... Ah! I'm so sorry! I was lost in thought.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You seem a bit down.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: It's very kind of you to be concerned, but I promise that I'm fine. I was just thinking... The Death Knight's true identity. Could it actually be Professor Jeritza?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What were you thinking about?

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: The Death Knight's true identity. Could it actually be Professor Jeritza?

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Gronder Field is in the Empire, right? I wonder how we'll get there. I thought I heard that there's no path that goes straight from the monastery to the Empire... Oh! Perhaps we'll travel through Alliance territory. Yes, I see, from the east, we would go...hm, there! Ah, yes, that must be it!

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Holding such a frivolous and downright ridiculous event so close to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion... It's absolutely absurd. Although...they did say we could eat whatever we catch. I'm a sucker for a good meal...I just couldn't resist.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: I received a rare letter from my father recently. He said that he is praying for the Golden Deer House to emerge victorious. Insistently praying. My father attended the Officers Academy, and won a glorious victory in the Battle of the Eagle and Lion. I think he is quite proud of that, even to this day. I suppose that shows how great an honor it truly is.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! Did you hear about the fishing tournament? You get to fish in the pond as much as you want. The more you catch, the more you get to eat!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Sometimes it's nice to dangle a fishing line and let your mind wander. I'd love to spend some time lounging around by a scenic river or lake.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Why would we go all the way to Gronder Field? It's idiocy to travel that far. It may be a tradition, but it takes forever to get there and is exhausting. So pointless. I guess there's nothing to be done about it. Even by you, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Excuse me, Professor. Um, do you think it would reflect poorly on me if I chose not to take part in the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Yes, it would.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Oh, I see...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Don't you want to participate?

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Well, I don't really want to leave the monastery...

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I'm not very confident, but I'll try my best.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Professor, do you have a second? It's about Monica. Does she seem...off to you? She was imprisoned for a long time, but she seems to have recovered almost instantly, and she's been bizarrely cheerful.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Now that you mention it...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: You see what I mean? I wonder if she's straining to seem happy, just to make people comfortable.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: She's moving on. Isn't that a good thing?

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I guess you're right. It just seems fast, doesn't it?

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Hmm... And why is she so close to Edelgard anyway?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Why are they having a fishing tournament now? Are they just giving up on the battle of the Eagle and Lion?! You're not condoning this, right? Are you?!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Yes, I'm taking part.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: What?! If you've got all this free time, shouldn't you be spending it on your students?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No, I'm not taking part.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Good. I'm looking forward to seeing you in action. I hope Captain Jeralt will be watching.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: The situation last month was dire indeed. The students endured great hardship. I hope you are able to put all of that behind you so that you may focus on this month's assignment.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Of course.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: A most reassuring response. I trust that your class is in good hands.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It will be difficult.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: That is to be expected. I, too, cannot quite shake that feeling of unease. Even so, we must both strive to put that nasty business behind us.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: I look forward to seeing your skills on display at the Battle of the Eagle and Lion.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: I have something to ask of you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Leave it to me.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: I have not even told you what my request is yet! Well, fine.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Flayn has been through an awful lot this past month. To make up for that, I have decided to give her whatever she wants. I asked her what she would like, and she expressed a desire for a feast of fish. Since I'm sure the students would be interested, I have decided to hold a fishing tournament here at the monastery. I have left all of the specifics to Shamir. Please, enter and put in your best effort.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: I hear that you participated in the fishing tournament. I appreciate you taking the time.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: I told my brother I had a craving for some tasty fish. I did not realize when I did that it would turn into...well, this. My apologies.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I'm going to catch me some mighty fish, just you wait and see! Er, but they haven't been biting...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Your shouting is scaring the fish.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: What shouting? Everyone told me I was too loud, so I've been using my quiet voice.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe the fish are frightened by you.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I didn't think of that. Ah, the truth is right in front of me...  Just kidding. As though a fish is smart enough to be afraid of me.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Can you believe what Seteth said? "Catch some tasty fish for Flayn." I'm her bodyguard!

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Welcome to the monastery fishing tournament. You look confused. Didn't Seteth tell you about it? Just catch whatever fish Flayn requests. Show any fish you catch to Flayn.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: The fishing tournament is over. I heard you did some fishing, and that Flayn is happy.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: Professor, has Seteth told you? We're to have a fishing tournament. Given the events of the last month, I believe this is just the sort of distraction we need, staff and student alike.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Will you take part?

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: I'm afraid I am not one for festivities. I do enjoy a spot of fishing, though.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Are you good at fishing?

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: I do enjoy the sport, yet I wouldn't say I'm particularly good at it.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: I believe it best that I stick to quietly fishing by myself.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: The recent happenings at the monastery... There is something going on behind the scenes here. I've been commissioned to investigate as well. As I've already mentioned, this month I'm off to the Kingdom. You be on your guard, OK?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not worried.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: Well, I hope you're right.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm more worried about you than myself.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: Perhaps I've gotten into your head too much! I won't go dying on you. I've stayed alive this long, after all.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: How are preparations for the Battle of the Eagle and Lion going? Hm? Fishing? Taking it easy, are you?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I don' t know if you've heard, but Flayn is very special. Her blood carries a rare Crest... Oh, the lengths to which she could advance my research, if only I was allowed to study her! If only it weren't for Seteth's strict orders! He protects his sister with unusual zeal.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You should give up.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I dislike it, but I agree. The time I would spend begging him and accomplishing nothing would be better spent on other research.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe you can convince him.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Have you ever tried convincing Seteth of anything? I'm not sure I could convince the man the sky is blue if he hadn't already looked up for himself.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: I always thought I was pretty good, you know? Then I go and get stabbed. Ugh... But my opponent was the Death Knight, so I figure I did pretty well to only get stabbed. I wonder if it's true that he is actually Jeritza... Whoever he is...I'm going to make him pay. It turns out that when I get stabbed, I get really mad!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: He hurt you this time. Next time he may kill you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'll help you get revenge.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: I'm not going to let him get the better of me again!

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: When you feel that first refreshing breeze upon your face, you know it is almost time for the Battle of the Eagle and Lion. Gronder Field is within the Empire, but the path there from the monastery necessitates passing through Alliance territory. Fódlan's biggest river, the Airmid River, flows along the border between the Empire and the Alliance. You will have to cross one of the largest bridges upon that river, the Great Bridge of Myrddin.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Fódlan is big. It's not as big as Almyra is, but it's still pretty big.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you want to travel around Fódlan someday?

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Travel? I don't know... Never thought about it, I guess.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you want to go home to Almyra?

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Why do you think I would want to do that?

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Young Monica disappeared last year. I thought she had simply run along home. But it turns out she was kidnapped! I can't believe it. How awful it must have been for the poor thing. They say her personality is completely changed, but at least she seems more cheerful than before. Grateful to be alive, perhaps?

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: Ah, I see. So you are Jeralt's child. You so resemble your mother.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Did you know my mother?

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: I did indeed. I was acquainted with your parents. I've been wanting to speak with you for a while now.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Who might you be?

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: I am nothing more than a common monk. I knew your parents...once upon a time.

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: I've been gone from the monastery for some time now because... Well, it matters not. Might I...ask a favor? Do you mind terribly picking up some fresh flowers to place upon your mother's grave? I am certain she'd be deeply moved to receive a gift from you.

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: Gronder Field is in the Empire. It's actually part of my family's territory - House Bergliez. It is the largest field in all of Fódlan. The grain it produces sustains the whole Empire. Wait... I sure hope we don't destroy all that grain.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: It is considered the most suitable place for a large-scale battle.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Professor, if it were up to you, how would you approach this battle?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I would fight them head-on.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I would surprise them with clever schemes.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: That sounds like a certain someone we both know. But as you wish. We'll use whatever strategy you think is best. If the Black Eagle House bands together, we won't lose.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Our strength is superior. So if we do lose, it would be on your shoulders, Professor.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: If you're not confident you can do this, just sit back and leave it to me.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: The most you will do is make things worse. You'll just get in Lady Edelgard's way.

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: Are you two about to fight? Haha! Count me in! Wait, no. I think we all need to calm down.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: We have no lack of opponents. I am ready to go hunting for our enemies!

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Hunting isn't exactly... Well, I guess they're pretty similar, actually.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: I'm just gonna hide in the fort and cheer everyone on. There, um, is a fort, right?

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Sure, but it's deep in enemy territory. How kind of you to offer to cut through for us.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: What?! No! That's not what I meant! Ugh, good work Bernie...

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: This will be your first battle, won't it, Flayn? You don't seem nervous at all.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Haha, I shall give it my all!

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Our battle will begin shortly. The flag of the Black Eagles will soon grace Gronder Field!

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: So, this is to be our battlefield...Gronder Field. Are you feeling confident, Professor?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Very.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Excellent. That's most reassuring.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm not so sure.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: We've seen your power firsthand, so we know better than anyone what you're capable of. Beyond that, we believe in you. If it's not too big a burden, I ask that you believe in us as well.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: We can win. I'm sure of it. After all, it's not as though we've spent the last half-year sitting idle. And I'm feeling stronger this moon. As though I could conquer a thousand opponents all on my own.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: That's reassuring.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: You can depend on me. I hope you know that.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Don't get carried away...

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: I'm only joking, of course... But perhaps it isn't a laughing matter. I beg your forgiveness. I must practice levity so that I can provide a more enjoyable joke when the opportunity next presents itself. After all, I hear that telling jokes is a good way to calm the nerves before heading into battle. Still...I find it quite difficult.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Well, it's about time for the battle to begin. Everyone, brace yourselves.

intro.speaker: Felix
intro.line: Hmph. All I'm worried about is finding someone worthy to cross swords with.

intro.speaker: Mercedes
intro.line: We've prepared and trained a great deal. We should be fine, right?

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: You're always so carefree, Mercie! Don't forget we need to try our hardest out there so we can win!

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: This is our chance to show how hard we've been working! Let's do our best.

intro.speaker: Sylvain
intro.line: If I emerge victorious in the lauded Battle of the Eagle and Lion, the ladies are sure to take notice. I'll have to go into hiding.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Ugh, is that all you think about? Actually, as long as you try your hardest, frame it however you like.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Haha, I shall give it my all!

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: No matter the battle, I will never falter.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: We're counting on your guidance, Professor. Let's show the world what the Blue Lions are made of!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: So this is Gronder Field... Hey, Teach. Not a bad place to wage war, is it?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: How so?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Absolutely.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I knew you'd understand.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Plenty of places to hide, and our pick of paths to advance through. It's the perfect battlefield for our tactics. I have my eye on that low hill over there. See it? It's the ideal spot to lure our enemies to, and then surround them with fire.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: It's risky.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Fire is unacceptable.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Gotcha, Teach! I know, I know. We want all students to make it back to the monastery. With you in command, we can't lose. The Imperial princess and the crown prince don't stand a chance.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Professor! Claude! What are you two talking about?

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: What do you expect? It's Claude. I expect he was foisting more of his ill-advised schemes on our poor professor.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Oh, you have me all figured out, Lorenz. You know me better than I know myself.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Win or lose, it's an honor just to participate in the legendary Battle of the Eagle and Lion!

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: We've got to win so we can show Captain Jeralt what we're made of!

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Yes! I'm ready! Let's go!

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Haha, I shall give it my all!

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: I'll just...stay quiet and follow along so I don't get in anyone's way.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: That will not be acceptable, Marianne. The whole point of this exercise is for each house to act as one.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Do your best! I can't wait to see how well everyone does.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: All right, sounds like Hilda will be taking control of a central hill and watching the battle from there.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: It's almost time. Come on, Teach! The battle starts now!

cutscene.speaker: Dimitri
cutscene.line: You all should know... I am not about to go easy on you today.

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: As long as we can pull off the win, it doesn't matter how.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: Our victory must be absolute...no matter what it may take.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: The Battle of the Eagle and Lion is set to begin at long last. Everyone, show off the results of your dedicated training!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Remember, we're not just fighting for honor. There's a prize at stake!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: It's almost time to begin. Steel yourselves, everyone.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: The Black Eagles and Blue Lions are fighting... Maybe we can sneak right past them.

battle.speaker: Lorenz
battle.line: A stronghold for me to seize? Splendid!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: There goes Lorenz, acting on his own... Guess we've got no choice but to capture the central hill and cover him!

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: This could be our chance! Dedue, cut through the Golden Deer!

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Ingrid, make use of your mobility—circle back behind the Black Eagles!

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Mobile force, you move up as well! Circle around to the rear of the Black Eagles!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: If you intend to act, do it now. Hubert! Head toward the Golden Deer!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Ferdinand, circle around to the back of the Blue Lions.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Mobile force, you move up as well. Circle around behind the Blue Lions.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: The Black Eagles and the Golden Deer are already in battle? We should take this chance to break through the Black Eagle's flank.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: I will draw the Black Eagles out, Your Highness.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Yes, and while you are doing so, we will take control of the central hill.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: If you stand in my way, I will cut you down until you have no blood left to bleed.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: What? I was just trying to rally your spirits. Now, to victory!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Hey Princess! Heads up! There's a rat right by your Imperial feet...

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: BAH! I—Huh. How dare you make a fool of me. You will not rile me with such childish tactics.

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Ah, so the sheer terror in your eyes was... something else entirely. My mistake. Anyway, it was only a joke.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: You really hope to unsettle me with childish jokes? It won't work. You must stand and fight!

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: So, it is time to cross blades... I never imagined such a day would come to pass.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: If the Empire and the Kingdom go to war, we'll be able to fight as much as we please.

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: I am sorry, but that is not something to joke about. The thought of fighting you is troubling at best.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: In that case, I wonder when you'll be able to stomach facing me in battle... Do you need a few moments?

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: This is a great chance for me to find out if the Sword of the Creator really is all it's cracked up to be. On that note, you'd better not surrender too quickly!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Hey, Your Royalness! If you promise to let me have the prize, I'll let you take the honor of victory. Do we have a deal?

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: Enough of your foolishness! I– Wait a moment. You are trying to anger me, is that it?

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Saw right through me, did you? Well, if there's no deal, I'll just have to win this thing fair and square!

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: I will happily face you, here and now. Do not hold back, Claude!

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: How far can I push myself with you as my foe... This will be a great chance to test our mettle. Do not underestimate me, Professor, or you will fail!

character-falls.speaker: Edelgard
character-falls.line: I'm sorry, but I must retreat... You should have no trouble winning. Don't give up!

character-falls.speaker: Edelgard
character-falls.line: I hate to admit it...but it seems this is as far as the Black Eagle House goes.

character-falls.speaker: Claude
character-falls.line: Sorry, but it's about time I make my exit… The rest of you...please, finish the job!

character-falls.speaker: Claude
character-falls.line: I hate to say it, but it seems we're at a stalemate. Looks like the Golden Deer won't be winning this round…

character-falls.speaker: Dimitri
character-falls.line: I fear I cannot fight any longer. I'm sorry, everyone… Please continue onward to victory!

character-falls.speaker: Dimitri
character-falls.line: I suppose my training wasn't enough… The Blue Lions have no choice but to retreat.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: It's finally over... There were way too many strangers at that feast.

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: Put your chin high, Bernie. It was a chance for you to have growth.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: But... but everyone was acting so friendly! It was overwhelming...

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: Linhardt, I wasn't done talking to you! If those Alliance guys came at it from here and those Kingdom guys came from there-

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: I know, I know. We'd have been able to take them all out at once. I heard you. I'm going to bed now.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Did anyone get the feeling that there were already couples forming? That's not really fair, is it? I wanted to sneak off with someone too...

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: I was hoping for some tea after our meal anyway. Would you care to join me?

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: I suppose I can settle for you just this once, Ferdie.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Until today, I thought it would fall to me to command and guide our ranks all by myself. But with you leading us, I've gotten to experience what it's like to fight alongside everyone... And I've realized... how happy it makes me, fighting under your command. The emperor doesn't take orders from anyone. It's their duty to stand alone and lead the entire Empire. But maybe it's better to have someone to rely on... so that you can support and guide each other through the darkness.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Am I that someone?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I am unfit to guide an emperor.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: I may be heir to the Imperial throne, but first and foremost, I'm your grateful student. That will never change, even when I fulfill my destiny and become the emperor. I told you long ago that I wished to enlist you in the service of the Empire. Well, I take it back. Now I wish only for your continued guidance during my eventual reign.

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Don't just hide away in the corner, Professor. You're the reason we're celebrating.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: It's because of you that I've had the courage to leave my room for a bit each day.  I'm...I'm so grateful, Professor!

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: We were all just discussing how well you led us. Remarkable!

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: Your guidance is without parallel, Professor.  I have had practicing of that phrase.

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: Your training's been top notch. Really!

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Whatever would we do without you?

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: I have had the opportunity to experience much. Please allow me to offer you my gratitude once more, Professor.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: I feel the same... You are something special, my teacher.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I had a wonderful time today, Professor. As usual, I was astonished by how much you ate in the name of celebration! Really, though, I must thank you again. Our victory in the Battle of the Eagle and Lion was thanks, in no small part, to you.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: We all did our part.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Yes, that is true, but it was your instruction that allowed us to reach our full potential.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I agree.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: That's the spirit! There's nothing wrong with acknowledging your own strengths every now and then.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I feel silly admitting this now, but when you first came to lead our class...you unnerved me. You never smiled, and you never showed anger either. And yet, you didn't appear to be suppressing your emotions. They just...weren't there. At first I thought perhaps you just didn't care for us, but I soon concluded that wasn't the case at all. For the longest time I just couldn't tell what you were thinking. It was as though you had no humanity whatsoever...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: That stings.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: And now?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: You're different now. In the half-year we've spent together, I've seen the glow of humanity in your eyes and in your actions countless times. I am truly grateful to have had the chance to spend this time with you, Professor.

end.speaker: Sylvain
end.line: What are you two talking about? How dare you get chummy without us!

end.speaker: Sylvain
end.line: Getting cozy, are we? Mind if I cut in?

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: That's enough, Sylvain.

end.speaker: Mercedes
end.line: Oh please, I would love to join you as well! I have so many things I wish to talk to you about, Professor.

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: Oh, me too! I have so much to tell you! And I want to thank you too.

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: Honestly Professor? I was only able to achieve so much because you were with us.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Ashe is right. You're irreplaceable to us, Professor.

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: Yes, that! Without you, the Blue Lions... Well, we wouldn't even be the Blue Lions at all! Except for the blue part. Because we'd be sad.

end.speaker: Felix
end.line: I suppose...there are worse things than fighting at your side.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: I have had the opportunity to experience much. Please allow me to offer you my gratitude once more, Professor.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Haha, as you can see, you have our trust, as well as our admiration. I look forward to spending the rest of the year with you.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: As do I.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Good. Then let's give it our all this year! Anyhow... It's getting late. We had better return to our quarters and get some rest.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Ugh, I can't believe our house leader ate so much he passed out. I guess he should just...sleep it off? Oh, Professor! Great work today!

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: As long as we have you and Claude, the Golden Deer House is unstoppable!

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: I am sure we did not require Claude for our victory, but it certainly would not have been possible without our professor.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Haha! I'm so please to be in your class, Professor. You truly bring out the best in us.

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: Let's keep fighting! And winning!

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: I knew the tactics you learned from the captain would be something else. I better work harder to catch up!

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: I have had the opportunity to experience much. Please allow me to offer you my gratitude once more, Professor.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: Because of you, I managed to get through the fight without feeling like a burden. Thank you, Professor.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: I hear Lady Rhea and Seteth are singing your praises too!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: You all worked hard.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: You're always so modest!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Our opponents were strong too.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Well, I certainly can't deny that.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Just wait until you see my true power.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Oh, wow! I don't doubt it.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: You really showed them, Teach! I would really hate to be on your bad side.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Oh, look. Claude has been revived.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Your tactics were ingenious, and you've somehow mastered the power of the King of Liberation's Relic. You really are incredible. Though you can be a bit absentminded at times. Your mind is like a giant bowl with a tiny crack in it...

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Claude, saying that only makes your own mind bowl seem tiny.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: How dare you! My bowl is much bigger than Teach's! Unfortunately, it doesn't just have a crack. The whole bottom of my bowl is missing.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: In other words, you are the absentminded one, not our professor.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: That's true. He just admitted it.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: Hehe!

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: It's unusual to hear you laughing, Marianne. Your smile is really cute.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: I agree. You really don't know how beauti-- Eh... Never mind.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: It feels so great to laugh and joke around like this, doesn't it?  Hm? Well, look at that. Someone's having a secret rendezvous in the courtyard...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: All joking aside, I'm having trouble sizing you up, Teach. The honest truth is that I'd hate to have you as an enemy. If possible, I wish for you to fight by my side. If I could use the Sword of the Creator, we wouldn't even be having this conversation. I bet if I could use it, you would trust me to... Right? That selflessness may be what I like best about you.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: You fought bravely during the Battle of the Eagle and Lion.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Comparing against their performance in the mock battle of the Great Tree Moon, the students have grown significantly. I suppose I should praise your efforts.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I can only call your deeds during the Battle of the Eagle and Lion...quite versatile.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Comparing against their performance in the mock battle of the Great Tree Moon, the students have grown significantly. It is clear that this is a result of your guidance.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: In appreciation of your efforts, and to show our high hopes for the future of your students, I award you with this.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Please continue to instruct your students as a model teacher.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: So! You've made good use of all my power after all. I would have been upset if you had failed at such an easy task!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: It pains me to assign such a disturbing mission to you during such a blessed moment in time... However, next month your assignment will be to journey to Remire Village to investigate an abnormal occurrence there.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Remire Village... If I recall, you've been there with your father many times.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: An abnormal occurrence?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I have yet to ascertain the details, but it would seem the villages have been acting strangely. I have already dispatched the knights to verify the authenticity of this information. They should be back shortly. I suggest you begin by finding out what they have discovered.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I pray this is not a bad omen... May the goddess protect you all.
